content:
CompSci 269S, Fall 2016: Theory Seminar

The Theory Group normally meets Fridays at 1:00pm; this quarter we are in DBH 1300.

Below is this quarter's schedule.

Sept 30:
Nil Mamano
Algorithms for Stable Matching and Clustering in a Grid
 
Oct 7:
Jordan Jorgensen
Improved Approximation Bounds for Planar Point Pattern Matching
 
Oct 14:
Tim Johnson
Drawing Trees with Low Ply Number
 
Oct 21:
Will Devanny
Track Layout is Hard
 
Oct 28:
Sid Gupta
A Topological Algorithm for Determining How Road Networks Evolve Over Time
 
Nov 4:
Juan Besa
Delta-Confluent Drawings
 
Nov 11:
Veteran's Day.
You are encouraged to attend the Southern California Theory Day.
 
Nov 18:
Pedro Matias
Differential Privacy: A Survey of Results
 
Nov 25:
Thanksgiving Holiday: no seminar.
 
Dec 2:
Elham Havvaei
Pebble Game Algorithms and Sparse Graphs

Previous quarters' theory seminars
